Generate options for optimization

Source: R/genopts.R
genopts.Rd

genopts() initializes and generates core options and settings for modeling and optimization, including random effects, simulation settings, and likelihood approximations.

Usage

genopts(
  f,
  g,
  xt,
  p,
  h,
  nsim = 1,
  n = 30,
  adist = NULL,
  interact = TRUE,
  fo_appr = (nsim < 10),
  biseq = NA,
  omega_expansion = 1,
  p_thetai = NA,
  single_betas = NA
)

Arguments

f

The likelihood function

g

The model function

xt

The data

p

The parameter settings

h

The error function

nsim

The number of simulations

n

The number of simulations

adist

The distribution of the random effects

interact

Whether to include interaction terms

fo_appr

Whether to use first-order approximation

biseq

The sequence of random effects

omega_expansion

The expansion factor for the omega matrix

p_thetai

The theta matrix

single_betas

The beta matrix

Value

A fitted model

Examples

#test

On this page
